course_title: Topics in Somatic Practices: Applied Yoga
class_notes:
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


Please contact Anna Leo for permission: aleo@emory.edu. Preference given to declared dance majors and minors.


Applied Yoga is designed for dancers and athletes seeking new ways to inform their area of physical study. Through the study and practice of yoga poses and self-observation, students will apply yoga concepts to their specific area of physical training. Students will gain new or deeper insight into the workings of their bodies through personalized investigations.
course_description: Somatic movement education builds a relationship between the body and mind by guiding the mover through a process of full body integration. A variety of somatic practices may be covered, including Bartenieff Fundamentals, Iyengar-based yoga, and Gyrokinesis movement training. Somatic practices can be applied to everyday activities and performance, affecting levels of confidence and encouraging authenticity.
